description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to strengthen the institutional capacity of the Liberia Land Authority and establish a land administration system.

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall ensure that not later than eighteen months (18) from the Effective Date, all LLA staff involved in Projectprocurement, have received training in procurement and contract management at an institution satisfactory to the Association(Schedule 2, Section IV of the FA)

The Recipient shall ensure that not later than three (3) months from the Effective Date, the LLA recruits the remaining ProjectImplementation Unit (PIU) staff, comprising, a financial management assistant, and monitoring and evaluation specialist all withqualifications, experience and terms of reference acceptable to the Association (Schedule 2, Section 1.A, 2 (a) of the FA)

The Recipient shall ensure that not later than three (3) months from the Effectiveness Date, the LLA enters into an MOU with thePFMU setting out the obligations of both parties in carrying out the Project satisfactory to the Association (Schedule 2, Section1.B, 2 (a) of the FA)

The Recipient shall ensure that prior to the carrying out of any field work related to the registration of customary land under theProject, the relevant Safeguards Documents related to said field work are prepared and furnished to the Association for its reviewand approval.
